                  1. Timeline section

                  How to use

                  1. How to use the screen
                  2. Description of the Timeline screen

                  How to use the screen

                  The whole screen contained from the header, filtering and the list of the results. The user can filter for the specific date by clicking on the black DATE row. This row is also swipeable, to the left and right for faster selecting previous or next day. The user can’t select the date in the future. Quick filter by typing the text is under the filtering by date. By clicking on the right icon filter_list, the dialog with selecting a specific type of event will be displayed. The list of results with a fast scroller is displayed under this filtering row.

                  The user could preview the event on the map - by clicking on the specific event. Once the map will be displayed, the user could see the information about the event, also with pin_drop the pin (marker) of the order/restaurant/customer depending on the event type and also the pin of the courier, with the specific position, when the courier performs that event.

                  Description of the Timeline screen

                  Here is the description of the screen:

                  1. Menu icon - opening the menu with all application sections
                  2. Name of the section - Timeline section is the default one, but you could select another section through Menu icon
                  3. Date of data - selected date, for which the events are displaying. The current date is the default one.
                  4. Search by the phrase - the user could dynamically search through by typing the text, list of results will be automatically filtered
                  5. Filter by type - if the user wants to filter the events by specific type, then use this filtering
                  6. Fast scroller - By long-click down on the fast scroller, the cook can reach the timeline more quickly. At the same time, the current time that is currently displayed is displayed as preview information.
                  7. Icon of the timeline
                  8. Time of the timeline - exact time, when this event was performed
                  9. Type of the timeline
                  10. Description of the timeline - details about the timeline like “New value”, “Name of the item”, “Filter data”, “Email”, “New value”, etc.
                  11. Additional info of the timeline - information, which could help determine the item, order or delivery
                  12. Courier position for that event - GPS position of the courier in the moment of executing that event
                  13. Customer position for that event - GPS position of the customer
                  14. Switch to previous/next event - skip to the previous or next event. The courier could also switch by swiping to the left/right side
